授業目的: The objective of this course is to understand how and why innovation is taking place in the European Union (EU) and other European regions. By reviewing recent news reports on industry and technology with the instructor, students will be able to understand the characteristics of European companies and the policies of the European Commission and EU member state governments to promote industry in the region, and analyze how European innovation will change in the future in an ever-changing global environment.
到達目標:
(1) To be able to explain the characteristics of innovation by European companies and its background in each country/region.
(2) To be able to deepen understanding of how Europe and major countries in the world such as the U.S., China, and Japan relate to each other in the field of industry and technology in the light of international politics.
(3) Students will be able to develop their ability to read the various news reports on European industry and technology from a unique perspective in order to understand future changes.

However, if the course is originally not credited toward graduation, it will not be determined as subject to the 60-credit limit for online courses, regardless of the online format.
授業の概要・背景: Europe, along with the U.S. and China, forms the core of the global economic triad. Deepening one's understanding of the innovations taking place in this region is an essential element in examining world affairs. Based on the lecturer's experience as a journalist engaged in international reporting, we will examine various aspects of innovation in each of Europe's major countries and technological fields.
授業方法: The course will be conducted in a hybrid format of face-to-face and on-demand classes. In each class, recent news reports on cutting-edge technologies will be explained and their background and significance will be analyzed. Face-to-face classes will include discussions on specific issues and opportunities for short presentations by students. Online in-class examinations will be scheduled.
